src_text: Energy
trg_text: Energy

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the interventions introduced by government to address the country s energy crisi The far-reaching measures pave the way to reduce load-shedding, transform the electricity sector and achieve long-term energy securit In supporting the energy grid and helping our country through its constrained electricity supply, we need to reduce our nation s energy consumption by 600 megawatts over the next three month
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the interventions introduced by government to address the country s energy crisi The far-reaching measures pave the way to reduce load-shedding, transform the electricity sector and achieve long-term energy securit In supporting the energy grid and helping our country through its constrained electricity supply, we need to reduce our nation s energy consumption by 600 megawatts over the next three month

src_text: Households can play their part in conserving energy by switching off all non-essential lighting and high-energy appliances during peak demand time Businesses are encouraged to adopt more energy-efficient production technology and participate in initiatives to reduce electricity deman 2.
trg_text: Households can play their part in conserving energy by switching off all non-essential lighting and high-energy appliances during peak demand time Businesses are encouraged to adopt more energy-efficient production technology and participate in initiatives to reduce electricity deman 2.

src_text: Operation Vulindlela
trg_text: Operation Vulindlela

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the progress made under Operation Vulindlela to clear bottlenecks across the energy, telecommunications, and water and tourism sectors to revive the econom Nine out of the 26 structural reforms have been achieved, with 11 reforms making good progres Successes include increasing the licensing threshold for embedded generation, the corporatisation of the Transnet National Ports Authority, release of the revised critical skills list and the implementation of the e-Visa system in 14 countries, including major new tourist markets such as China, India, Kenya and Nigeri 3.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the progress made under Operation Vulindlela to clear bottlenecks across the energy, telecommunications, and water and tourism sectors to revive the econom Nine out of the 26 structural reforms have been achieved, with 11 reforms making good progres Successes include increasing the licensing threshold for embedded generation, the corporatisation of the Transnet National Ports Authority, release of the revised critical skills list and the implementation of the e-Visa system in 14 countries, including major new tourist markets such as China, India, Kenya and Nigeri 3.

src_text: Women s Month The annual Women s Month in August pays tribute to women who participated in the liberation struggle and all women in our societ
trg_text: Women s Month The annual Women s Month in August pays tribute to women who participated in the liberation struggle and all women in our societ

src_text: This year s Women Month is being celebrated under the theme:
trg_text: This year s Women Month is being celebrated under the theme:

src_text: Women s Socio-Economic Rights and Empowerment: Building Back Better for Women s Improved Resilience .
trg_text: Women s Socio-Economic Rights and Empowerment: Building Back Better for Women s Improved Resilience .

src_text: The over 20 000 women who marched to the Union Buildings in Pretoria on 9 August 1956 contributed to ensuring that gender equality and empowerment remains a key priority in a democratic South Afric Their brave actions inspired women in general to take their rightful place in Parliament, government and civil society, and we are constantly building on these advances since gaining freedom in 1994.
trg_text: The over 20 000 women who marched to the Union Buildings in Pretoria on 9 August 1956 contributed to ensuring that gender equality and empowerment remains a key priority in a democratic South Afric Their brave actions inspired women in general to take their rightful place in Parliament, government and civil society, and we are constantly building on these advances since gaining freedom in 1994.

src_text: Marikana commemoration On Tuesday, 16 August 2022, government joined the rest of the country in remembering the tragedy that unfolded at Marikana in North West in 2012.
trg_text: Marikana commemoration On Tuesday, 16 August 2022, government joined the rest of the country in remembering the tragedy that unfolded at Marikana in North West in 2012.

src_text: The pain felt by the workers, their families and the nation at large would forever be entrenched in our histor
trg_text: The pain felt by the workers, their families and the nation at large would forever be entrenched in our histor

src_text: The Marikana Renewal Programme has been implemented to rebuild and create an enabling environment to improve the lives of the Marikana communit Last year government paid R176 million in compensation to the families of the victims and the remaining cases under litigation are expected to be finalised by the end of August 2022.
trg_text: The Marikana Renewal Programme has been implemented to rebuild and create an enabling environment to improve the lives of the Marikana communit Last year government paid R176 million in compensation to the families of the victims and the remaining cases under litigation are expected to be finalised by the end of August 2022.

src_text: District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Gauteng
trg_text: District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Gauteng

src_text: Following the success of the previous three DDM Presidential Izimbizo hosted in North West, Free State and Mpumalanga respectively, the Sedibeng District Municipality in Gauteng hosted the fourth instalment on Friday, 12 August 2022.
trg_text: Following the success of the previous three DDM Presidential Izimbizo hosted in North West, Free State and Mpumalanga respectively, the Sedibeng District Municipality in Gauteng hosted the fourth instalment on Friday, 12 August 2022.

trg_text: Under the theme:

src_text: Leave no one behind , President Cyril Ramaphosa led the delegation of senior officials from the national, provincial and local government South Africans in their various formations and sectors were mobilised to act together against rising levels of poverty and destitution caused by the challenging economic condition

src_text: Presidential Social Sector Summit The Presidential Social Sector Summit held in Ekurhuleni, Gauteng from 4 to 5 August 2022 under the theme:

trg_text: Fostering Social Cohesion to Enable Socio-Economic Participation in Communities , brought together stakeholders from different constituencies to work with government to address socio-economic challenges and mobilise resources for civil society, among other objective

src_text: The summit considered dialogue reports from the nine provinces on their challenges, which included access to funding, regulatory issues, transformation of the social sector with a view to fostering a state-civil society partnership to address challenges related to poverty, inequality and unemploymen
trg_text: The summit considered dialogue reports from the nine provinces on their challenges, which included access to funding, regulatory issues, transformation of the social sector with a view to fostering a state-civil society partnership to address challenges related to poverty, inequality and unemploymen

src_text: Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan Cabinet approved the Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan for implementatio The masterplan focuses on visual arts; crafts and design; audio-visual and interactive media; design and creative services; performance and celebration, including music, publishing and printed medi
trg_text: Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan Cabinet approved the Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan for implementatio The masterplan focuses on visual arts; crafts and design; audio-visual and interactive media; design and creative services; performance and celebration, including music, publishing and printed medi

src_text: The masterplan will intervene in these sectors towards building a transformed creative innovative sector that will be globally recognised and competitive in the spac It will work towards the South African creative industry being able to access the local and international market 2.

src_text: Updated Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencies Cabinet approved the amendments to the current Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencie The amendments are mainly on the borrowing section of this framewor
trg_text: Updated Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencies Cabinet approved the amendments to the current Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencie The amendments are mainly on the borrowing section of this framewor

src_text: Amongst the amendments
trg_text: Amongst the amendments

src_text: proposed introducing a longer-term borrowing period to match the useful lifespan of some of the assets being finance The amendments also clarify the role of development finance institutions in the lending space of the municipalitie Section 230 of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 empowers municipalities to raise loans for their capital or current expenditur The original framework was approved by Cabinet in 2000 to guide Chapter 6 and 13 of the Municipal Finance Act, 2003 (Act 56 of 2003).

src_text: The approved amendments seek to incentivise more lenders in the municipality markets but continue to maintain the core principles underlying municipal borrowin 3.
trg_text: The approved amendments seek to incentivise more lenders in the municipality markets but continue to maintain the core principles underlying municipal borrowin 3.

src_text: Pre-release calendar for the publication of the quarterly recorded crime statistics for 2022/23 financial year Cabinet approved the proposed pre-release calendar for the publication of the quarterly crime statistics for the 2022/23 financial yea Cabinet approved the quarterly crime stats releas This was to change the previous annual release of the crime stats for the countr The proposed pre-release calendar crime statistics is August 2022 for quarter one and November 2022 for quarter tw Crime statistics for quarter three and quarter four will be released in February and May 2023 respectivel 4.

src_text: Lapse of the National State of Disaster (NSoD) Cabinet approved the lapse of the National State of Disaster (NSoD) that was declared following the devastating floods in the Eastern Cape and KwaZulu-Nata
trg_text: Lapse of the National State of Disaster (NSoD) Cabinet approved the lapse of the National State of Disaster (NSoD) that was declared following the devastating floods in the Eastern Cape and KwaZulu-Nata

src_text: The NSoD lapsed on 18 August 2022 following its extension on 18 July 2022.
trg_text: The NSoD lapsed on 18 August 2022 following its extension on 18 July 2022.

src_text: The extension considered the need to continue augmenting the existing contingency measures undertaken by organs of state to mitigate and address the impact of severe weather in the affected province
trg_text: The extension considered the need to continue augmenting the existing contingency measures undertaken by organs of state to mitigate and address the impact of severe weather in the affected province

src_text: Cabinet agreed that current circumstances no longer warrant the extraordinary measures as organs of state, the private sector and civil society will continue to ensure ongoing relief, recovery and reconstructio
trg_text: Cabinet agreed that current circumstances no longer warrant the extraordinary measures as organs of state, the private sector and civil society will continue to ensure ongoing relief, recovery and reconstructio

trg_text: Bills1.

src_text: Deeds Registries Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission of the Deeds Registries Amendment Bill of 2020 to Parliament for further processin Cabinet approved the Bill in June 2020 for further public consultatio The proposed amendments will give effect to the realisation of the land tenure that is legally secured in Section 25(6) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.
trg_text: Deeds Registries Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission of the Deeds Registries Amendment Bill of 2020 to Parliament for further processin Cabinet approved the Bill in June 2020 for further public consultatio The proposed amendments will give effect to the realisation of the land tenure that is legally secured in Section 25(6) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.

src_text: The Bill provides for the collection of the statistics in terms of race, gender, nationality and citizenship of the holders of land rights in South Afric This provision will enable more accurate land audit reports and surveys in the future regarding the transformation of land ownershi 2.
trg_text: The Bill provides for the collection of the statistics in terms of race, gender, nationality and citizenship of the holders of land rights in South Afric This provision will enable more accurate land audit reports and surveys in the future regarding the transformation of land ownershi 2.

src_text: National Water Resource Infrastructure Agency (NWRIA) Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the publishing of the NWRIA Bill of 2022 for public comment for a period of ninety (90) day The Bill proposes the setting up of an NWRIA to be responsible for the planning, financing and development of the water infrastructure for the countr It will also be responsible for the maintenance of the current water infrastructur The agency is to ensure a sustainable, equitable and reliable supply of water in line with constitutional obligations of access to water and a secure healthy environmen The agency will be set up as a Public Entity under the Schedule 2 of the Public Finance Management Act, 1999 (Act 1 of 1999).
trg_text: National Water Resource Infrastructure Agency (NWRIA) Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the publishing of the NWRIA Bill of 2022 for public comment for a period of ninety (90) day The Bill proposes the setting up of an NWRIA to be responsible for the planning, financing and development of the water infrastructure for the countr It will also be responsible for the maintenance of the current water infrastructur The agency is to ensure a sustainable, equitable and reliable supply of water in line with constitutional obligations of access to water and a secure healthy environmen The agency will be set up as a Public Entity under the Schedule 2 of the Public Finance Management Act, 1999 (Act 1 of 1999).

src_text: The agency will take on the functions that are currently performed by the Trans-Caledon Tunnel Authorit 3.
trg_text: The agency will take on the functions that are currently performed by the Trans-Caledon Tunnel Authorit 3.

src_text: Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Amendment Bill of 2022.
trg_text: Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Amendment Bill of 2022.

src_text: The Bill amends the Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Act, 2007 (Act 12 of 2007).
trg_text: The Bill amends the Municipal Fiscal Powers and Functions Act, 2007 (Act 12 of 2007).

src_text: The amendments regulate the powers of municipalities in levying development charges in respect of land development applications submitted to municipalitie
trg_text: The amendments regulate the powers of municipalities in levying development charges in respect of land development applications submitted to municipalitie

src_text: These amendments will ensure municipalities apply these charges fairly, transparently and effectivel Cabinet approved the Bill in 2020 for public consultatio 4.
trg_text: These amendments will ensure municipalities apply these charges fairly, transparently and effectivel Cabinet approved the Bill in 2020 for public consultatio 4.

src_text: Financial Matters Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Financial Matters Amendments Bill, 2022.
trg_text: Financial Matters Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Financial Matters Amendments Bill, 2022.

src_text: The Bill proposes the amendment to seven Acts, namely (1) Associated Institutions Pension Fund Act, 1963 (Act 41 of 1963); (2) Military Pension Act,1976 (Act 84 of 1976); (3) Government Employees Pension Law of 1996; (4) Financial and Fiscal Commission Act,1997 (Act 99 of 1997); (5) Land and Agricultural Development Bank Act, 2002 (Act 15 of 2002); (6) Audit Profession Act 2005 (Act 26 of 2005) and
trg_text: The Bill proposes the amendment to seven Acts, namely (1) Associated Institutions Pension Fund Act, 1963 (Act 41 of 1963); (2) Military Pension Act,1976 (Act 84 of 1976); (3) Government Employees Pension Law of 1996; (4) Financial and Fiscal Commission Act,1997 (Act 99 of 1997); (5) Land and Agricultural Development Bank Act, 2002 (Act 15 of 2002); (6) Audit Profession Act 2005 (Act 26 of 2005) and

src_text: the (7) Auditing Profession Amendment Act 2021 (Act 5 of 2021).
trg_text: the (7) Auditing Profession Amendment Act 2021 (Act 5 of 2021).

src_text: The proposed amendments include, under the Military Pension Act of 1996, the inclusion of life partners to the benefits retrospectively from 27 April 1994.
trg_text: The proposed amendments include, under the Military Pension Act of 1996, the inclusion of life partners to the benefits retrospectively from 27 April 1994.

src_text: The pension laws amendments will enable spouses to realise their pension interest immediately on dissolution of the marriag In addition to clarifying the role of the Minister of Finance and on the auditing, the amendments also adjust the powers of the enforcement committee where an auditor admits guil The Bill was published for public comment in February 2022.
trg_text: The pension laws amendments will enable spouses to realise their pension interest immediately on dissolution of the marriag In addition to clarifying the role of the Minister of Finance and on the auditing, the amendments also adjust the powers of the enforcement committee where an auditor admits guil The Bill was published for public comment in February 2022.

src_text: General Laws (Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Terrorism Financing) Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission of the General Laws (Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Terrorism Financing) Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processin The Bill is an omnibus Bill that amends the current Acts namely (i) Financial Intelligence Centre Act, 2001 (Act 38 of 2001); (ii) Nonprofit Organisation Act, 1997 (Act 71 of 1997); (iii) Trust Property Control Act, 1988 (Act 57 of 1988); (iv) Companies Act, 2008 (Act 71 of 2008) and (v) Financial Sector Regulations Act, 2017( Act 9 of 2017).
trg_text: General Laws (Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Terrorism Financing) Amendment Bill of 2022 Cabinet approved the submission of the General Laws (Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Terrorism Financing) Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processin The Bill is an omnibus Bill that amends the current Acts namely (i) Financial Intelligence Centre Act, 2001 (Act 38 of 2001); (ii) Nonprofit Organisation Act, 1997 (Act 71 of 1997); (iii) Trust Property Control Act, 1988 (Act 57 of 1988); (iv) Companies Act, 2008 (Act 71 of 2008) and (v) Financial Sector Regulations Act, 2017( Act 9 of 2017).

src_text: The amendments respond to the deficiencies identified during the peer review of the country conducted by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF).
trg_text: The amendments respond to the deficiencies identified during the peer review of the country conducted by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF).
